availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Mondiek (Covington, Kentucky, teamster and grocer.)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, teamster and grocer. Native of Oldenburg. Son of Joseph Mondiek. Married to Elizabeth Berger Mondiek. Father of Henry Mondiek, Barney Mondiek, Anthony Mondiek, Mary Mondiek, and William Mondiek. Teamster in Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Grocer in Covington in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 6, p. 808.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 390D.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Kenton County, KY, June-July 1863, p. 152.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 30386.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344510, p. 412.
"Oldest Citizen is Dead," The Kentucky Post (Covington, KY), November 19, 1919, p. 1.
Williams' Covington Directory for 1861 (Cincinnati: Williams & Co., 1861), 436.
KYR-0001-004-00670.
